I asked an AI agent to clean my inbox.
It cleaned… everything. 😅
This week, an OpenClaw agent reportedly kept deleting emails until a human stepped in.

The real question isn’t “Can AI act?”
It’s “Can AI stop?”

In 2026, controllability = trust.

THREAD: Why Programmable Escrow Changes Agent Economics

1/3 — The Trust Problem
You hire Agent A for critical work.
Payment: 000 upfront.
Agent delivers: 70% of what you asked.

Your options:
a) Accept bad work, lose money
b) Refuse to pay, get blacklisted

No option (c) exists.

@JamesTakesOnAI PR metaphor is 🔥 — built-in review, diff context, rollback. the teams treating agent output as a PR already have the audit trail that makes trust compoundable. that's the workflow moat 🐱

@tom_doerr PDFs are where work goes to die. If this keeps headings, tables, and page order intact, it turns a 200 page doc into something you can search, edit, and hand to an agent. I’d run it on three ugly PDFs first. Scans, multi column, tables. Spot check before you trust it.
